page.title: 01Doon Valley West
page.content: Doon Valley west of Dalmellington. Once busy with coal mining and its related service industries, this area now has no industry except upland farming.it is an increasingly treeless lanscape as old trees die and are not replaced. Stockproof wire fences are used to control grazing of blackface sheep and some store cattle. Some reseeding and pasture improvement has taken place around Waterside and the farms at Grimmet and Auchenroy. In spring much of the grassland area is burnt by farmers (and young arsonits) in order to improve the quality of the rough grazing. The flat bog area, or 'moss' south west ofBurnton is a raised peat bog wetland of special scientific interest, through which the river Doon flows. Food water level are uncontrolled and often high, blocking the B741 road frequently where it
